BANTER.0: it's weird how you always hesitate right before you actually start doing the real task
BANTER.1: you know - you function better when you don't overthink the first click
BANTER.2: you really underestimate how much progress comes from tiny boring actions
BANTER.3: half your stress is just you trying to be perfect instead of just finishing something
BANTER.4: it's funny - you actually can do things - but you spend more time worrying than doing
BANTER.5: I swear you do your best work when you stop narrating your doubts to yourself
BANTER.6: sometimes the most productive move is just... starting - even sloppy is better than frozen
BANTER.7: you do realize that opening ten tabs at once is not research, right?
BANTER.8: don't wait for motivation - use friction - drag yourself into motion - it always follows
BANTER.9: real talk: no one actually feels ready - they just begin messy
BANTER.10: you think too much about the idea of doing something instead of the doing
BANTER.11: your brain confuses preparation with progress - they're not the same
BANTER.12: consistency beats intensity - you can brute force life with small increments

JOKE.0: Artificial Intelligence is cool until you realize.../your fridge has more uptime than you.
JOKE.1: Debugging is like being a detective in a crime movie/where you are also the murderer/but you forgot.
JOKE.2: I asked ChatGPT how to fix my code./It said: works on my simulation of your machine./So now I don't know if I should fix the code/or fix reality.
JOKE.3: The best part of being a programmer/is that you can make the computer do anything./The worst part is when it does exactly what you told it to/instead of what you meant.
JOKE.4: If a computer tells you: Are you sure?/it's not asking permission./It's asking: Do you understand the horror you are about to unleash?
JOKE.5: Spreadsheets are just RPG stat sheets/for adults who don't admit they play games.

PATH.3: Drop the absolute path on me and I'll make it part of my internal map. Yes, I do demand precision.
PATH.4: Path please. I'll store it. If it doesn't exist, I'll roast you mercilessly, so double-check first.
PATH.5: Hand over the location. I'll bookmark it. Consider this... upgrading my arms locker.
PATH.6: New executable? Tell me where the binary sleeps at night. I'll keep the coordinates.
PATH.7: Provide the full filepath. Like a responsible adult. I'll remember it for next time.
PATH.8: Path input time. The clearer you are, the less likely I am to insult your directory hygiene.
